EmailTemplate.name: SpringOne2GX 2014.Early Bird Ends August 9th - 8/3/14
EmailTemplate.subject: Early Bird Registration ends August 9th
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Early Bird Registration ends August 9th! REGISTER NOW! <http://www.springone2gx.com> Reserve your spot for the pre-event training now! 2 Day immersion training for only $200.00 USD! See below for details. Also, much of the content program has been determined with lots of great sessions lined up. Check our website <http://www.springone2gx.com/> for speaker and session updates, and mark your calendar!
FEATURED SESSION with JUERGEN HOELLER
Caching and Messaging Improvements in Spring Framework 4.1 <https://2014.event.springone2gx.com/schedule/sessions/caching_and_messaging_improvements_in_spring_framework_4_1.html> This session showcases major new features along the lines of two key themes in Spring Framework 4.1: We’ll start with numerous improvements around the caching abstraction, as requested by the community, including the support for JCache (JSR-107) standard annotations. We’ll then move on to messaging-related features such as annotated JMS listener endpoints with flexible method signatures, using the messaging abstraction introduced in Spring Framework 4.0 and therefore aligning our core JMS support with our STOMP endpoint style.
Huge Discount on Immersion Training at the show!
If you select a registration package that includes the $200 two-day Immersion Training, you will be contacted to select one of the three options. You must attend only one of the Immersion Trainings for September 7-8, 2014. Day 2 training on September 8, 2014 will end before the official start of activities for SpringOne 2GX 2014.
- Developing Applications for the Cloud, Immersion Training (Sunday & Monday - Sep 7 & 8, 2014) - Pivotal Cloud Foundry for Operators, Immersion Training (Sunday & Monday - Sep 7 & 8, 2014) - Hadoop for Developers, Immersion Training (Sunday & Monday - Sep 7 & 8, 2014)
This is a one-of-a-kind conference for application developers, solution and data architects who develop business applications, create multi-device aware web applications, process vast quantities of enterprise data, design cloud architectures, and manage high performance infrastructure. The sessions are specifically tailored for developers using the hugely popular open source Spring IO Projects, Groovy & Grails, CloudFoundry, Apache Hadoop and Tomcat technologies. Whether you're building mission-critical web or business applications, crunching huge amounts of distributed data, or designing the next killer cloud application, SpringOne 2GX will keep you up to date with the latest enterprise technology.
Featuring presentations delivered by development leads, committers, and published authors, it's the ideal place to obtain critical skills to help you design, build and run tomorrow's software solutions. Plus you'll meet and learn from open source leaders <https://2014.event.springone2gx.com/presenters> who drive innovation for these technologies.
See you there,
The Spring Team at Pivotal <http://www.gopivotal.com>
